titles.title: A bill to eliminate notarization requirements for absentee voting documents submitted by absent uniformed services voters for Federal elections, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 10/22/1987--Introduced. Declares that an absent uniformed services voter shall not be required to appear before a notary public or other officer as a condition for submission of an absentee voting document for a Federal election. Requires such absentee ballots to be counted by State officials if they are received before completion of the final canvass of voters of the final count of votes.
